alert.note: Alert for Hempstead; Howard; Lafayette; Little River; Miller; Nevada (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 04 at 12:51PM CDT until October 04 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Hempstead County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Howard County in southwestern Arkansas... North Central Lafayette County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Little River County in southwestern Arkansas... Northeastern Miller County in southwestern Arkansas... West Central Nevada County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 1251 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Texarkana, Hope, Emmet, Perrytown, Fulton, McNab, Patmos, Oakhaven, Hervey, Homan, Piney Grove, Red Bluff, Bright Star and Millwood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Hempstead; Howard; Lafayette; Little River; Miller; Nevada
